name: Vampire Planet people
overview: Vampire-humanoids

name: Vanryn
overview: Related to Earth people. They once possessed a great interstellar empire, but are now a low-technology people, restricted to their home world Ryn (a planet of Altair).

name: Vargr
overview: Genetically-altered canine stock taken from Terra by the Ancients

name: Ventrexians
overview: Race of anthropomorphic cats native to the planet Ventrexia similar in stature to humans. War and martial ability are central to Ventrexian culture and history, as they were at war with their rivals the Tryvuulians for over 1000 years.

name: Vashta Nerada
overview: Tiny, swarming creatures found in the shadows; like piranhas or ants, they strip their prey to the bone.

name: Vasudans
source: Descent: FreeSpace â€“ The Great War
overview: Humanoid

name: Vauvusar
overview: Amphibianoid

name: Vaxasaurian
overview: Dinosaur-like aliens from the planet Terradino. Vaxasaurians can change their size to be up to 60 feet tall, gaining features like tail spikes and plates on their back. In the reboot, they retain a similar design to their original selves, but they lose their size changing abilities. To compensate, Vaxasaurians wield bony weapons on the ends of their tails, ranging from hammers to spiked maces to swords, able to hit objects with them to unleash shockwaves.

name: Velantians
overview: Thirty-foot, crocodile-headed, winged pythons with eyes that come out on stalks

name: Venek
overview: Humanoid

name: Verga
source: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's The Lost World
overview: Frozen insect-like humanoids with blue skin

name: Vinean
overview: Humanoids with blue skin

name: Visitors
overview: Stereotypical looking aliens with gray skin and tear-shaped heads and eyes. They are genderless.

name: Vogons
source: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
overview: Unsightly humanoids, described as "not actually evil, but bad-tempered, bureaucratic, officious and callous". They originate from Vogsphere, where they used surgery rather than natural evolution to achieve their current form. They pilot Vogon Constructor Fleets, which are used to obliterate planets.

name: Void whales
overview: Whale-like non-sapient omnivorous species capable of surviving in hard vacuum and large enough to swallow small spacecraft whole.

name: Vok
overview: Mysterious aliens who seem to resemble floating, gaseous skulls; their base of operations (be it a planet or even a whole other dimension) is Nexus Zero. They apparently have some jurisdiction over the stability of time and space and use highly advanced technology, including the Planet-Buster. Some consider them to be an evolved form of the Swarm, "purified" by Optimus Prime with the Matrix.

name: Vorc
overview: Humanoid

name: Vorcarian bloodtracker
overview: Humanoid

name: Vorlons
overview: True appearance unknown; they wear encounter suits when in the presence of other intelligent life to hide their true forms. Encounter suit appearances vary.

name: Vorta
overview: Humanoid

name: Vortians
overview: Vortians are characterized by their goat-like physiology (hooves, horns, etc.) The Vortians are a technologically advanced race, providing the Irkens with advanced military technology. The Vortian home world, Vort, was conquered by Invader Larb and is now Irk's top military research prison.

name: Vorticon
overview: Humanoid

name: Vortigaunt
overview: Humanoid

name: Vrusk
overview: Insectoid centauroid

name: Vulcans
overview: Humanoid

name: Vulkanette
overview: Humanoid species that is a parody of the Vulcan species and splits into two subspecies, vulgaris and brutalis. The only one member is Mr. Spuck.

name: Vulpimancer
overview: Dog-like aliens which are native to the planet Vulpin, which had been used as a dumping ground for hazardous waste and stands at the edge of the galaxy. Vulpimancers have no eyes (a combination of their pitch dark planet and its toxic environment), but compensate with highly enhanced smell and hearing that they can use to "see" via a 3d map.

name: Vyrium
overview: Reptilian

name: Vy'keen
overview: Honorable warriors in the Universe of NMS.
